channel.title: Projects on Alex Gagliano
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Alex Gagliano

item.title: Simulating Transients and their Host Galaxies
item.description: Embedding realistic host-galaxy correlations into a simulated sample of transients for PLASTiCC v2.0.

item.title: Unveiling the Physics of SN 2020oi in M100
item.description: An investigation into the unusual early-time optical and UV flux excess of SN 2020oi, a type-Ic explosion in M100.

item.title: Galaxies Hosting Supernovae and other Transients (GHOST)
item.description: Can we classify supernovae using only the properties of the galaxies where they occur?

item.title: Waternet: A Chemical Network for Cosmological-Scale Molecular Studies
item.description: How early in the universe did water form, and how common is it in high-redshift galaxies?

item.title: Sounds of the Spectrum
item.description: For thousands of years, we have used our eyes to study the cosmos, but what if we could use our ears?

item.title: Ethnoastronomy in Gabon
item.description: I traveled to Gabon in 2016 and interviewed local anthropologists to learn about traditional astronomy beliefs in the region.

item.title: Globular Clusters in Coma
item.description: Using the largest map created to date of globular clusters in Coma to derive the global structure of the population.

item.title: Impact of Open Source Software
item.description: Can we aid the National Science Foundation in quantifying innovation in Open Source Software (OSS)?

item.title: The Impact of Autonomous Vehicles on Washington State Traffic Flows
item.description: Would increasing the number of driverless cars in Washington State improve traffic flows?
